hadith: The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The prayer is a light, and charity is a proof of faith, and patience is a brightness, and the Qur'an is a proof for you or against you.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The best of your prayers are those which are prayed in your homes, except for the obligatory prayers.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'When a servant of Allah stands for prayer, he is conversing with his Lord.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Indeed, the prayer prevents one from immorality and wrongdoing.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'If anyone of you prays, let him cover himself, for Allah is more deserving of modesty than the people.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'A personâ€™s prayer is not accepted if he has something stuck between his teeth that could be seen for a long time.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The closest that a servant comes to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so make plenty of supplication (dua) during it.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Whoever prays Fajr in congregation, he is in the protection of Allah.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Whoever prays 2 rak'ahs of prayer and perfects them, Allah will forgive his previous sins.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The prayer of a person who does not perform ablution is not accepted.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Perform the prayer in your houses and do not make them graves.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'If a man prays at night and he recites the Qur'an, it is better for him.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The best of your prayers is that which you perform in your homes and that which is performed in the mosque.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The prayer is the first thing for which a servant will be held accountable on the Day of Resurrection.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'There are angels who accompany you and write down your prayer.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'When one of you finishes the prayer, let him say: 'O Allah, forgive me my mistakes and my ignorance, and any of my errors in my affairs.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The two rak'ahs before Fajr are better than the world and what it contains.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Pray two rak'ahs of prayer at the time of hardship, and they will bring you ease.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Allah does not look at your appearance or wealth, but He looks at your hearts and your actions.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'If the prayer of a person does not prevent him from committing immoral acts, he has not performed it properly.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The one who performs the prayer with humility has the weight of a mountain.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'There is a gate in Paradise that is called 'Prayer'.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Your prayer is a shield against the fire of Hell.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The one who observes the five daily prayers will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Pray as you have seen me pray.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The one who prays the night prayer will be in the company of the Prophets.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Indeed, your prayers should not become a burden on you, but a source of comfort.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Do not be like those who do not pray, for they are not from me.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Prayer is the best of deeds after belief in Allah.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The prayer of a person who prays while he is intoxicated is not accepted until he is sober.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The prayer performed in congregation is twenty-seven times better than the prayer performed alone.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Allah has made it obligatory for you to pray five times a day.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Do not let the prayer become a burden; pray at your ease.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The one who misses a prayer deliberately is like a man who loses his family and wealth.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'If one of you forgets a prayer, let him pray it when he remembers it.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Your prayer should be with your heart present, and do not let your heart wander.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The prayer is a duty and a right upon every Muslim.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Indeed, Allah loves when any one of you performs a deed, he should perfect it.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'He who performs the evening prayer is in the protection of Allah until the morning.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Your prayer will not be accepted if you do not recite Surah Al-Fatiha.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'If you pray in congregation, do not leave the rows.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The prayer is a means of attaining peace and tranquility.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Perform the prayer at night, as it was the practice of the righteous before you.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'Be mindful of your prayers, for they are your guide to success.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The one who prays the night prayer is like a man who defends his family and wealth.'
The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, 'The one who observes prayer will be like the one who remembers Allah.'
